intro: Gonostegia concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf gonostegia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Gonostegia concinna is often found in open habitats and is considered a rare species in its native range.
